answers.author: Maria Ratliff
answers.text:
We do not. I have attached the full job outline for your review but the following quotes summarize our requirements: "North Carolina Class “C” Driver’s License, Standard Level III Fire Inspector Certificate issued by the N.C. Code Officials Qualification Board, and the Law Enforcement Certification by the State of N.C." and "Work requires broad knowledge in a general professional or technical field.  Knowledge is normally acquired through four years of college resulting in a Bachelor's degree or equivalent."-- Durham Fire Department, Durham, NC

answers.author: Matthew Reges
answers.text:
No. Our Fire Marshal needs: 
NFPA 1021 Fire Officer I 
NFPA 1033 Fire Investigator II 
NFPA 1031 Fire Inspector II 
NFPA 1041 Fire Instructor I 
EMT- B

NFPA 1033 Fire Investigator II 
NFPA 1031 Fire Inspector II 
NFPA 1041 Fire Instructor I 
EMT- B

author: Jeffrey Fiegenschuh
text: Does your community require your Fire Marshall to carry the FF I & II designations?
title: Fire Marshall
